importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the indictment, indicating the official timeline of legal action against John Bolton.

keyTakeAways: John Bolton, a former national security adviser to President Donald Trump, has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Maryland.
The indictment includes 18 charges: eight counts of transmitting national defense information and 10 counts of retaining such information.
The charges relate to alleged violations of federal laws governing the handling of sensitive national defense information.

summaryOfNewsArticle: John Bolton, former national security adviser to President Donald Trump, has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Maryland on 18 counts, including eight for transmitting and ten for retaining classified national defense information. This marks a significant development in the legal scrutiny of former White House officials involved in national security operations, especially amid ongoing political and legal debates about accountability and information handling.
title: Full indictment of John Bolton
